COVID-19 negative certification is required for entering the country. All travellers should complete and submit the health declaration form (EHAS process) 72 hours prior to travel. Part of the application process is the purchase of a mandatory COVID-19 insurance.
If you’re fully vaccinated, you can enter St Maarten without needing to test or quarantine.
If you’re not fully vaccinated, you’ll need to show proof of a negative PCR test, taken no more than 48 hours before departure, when entering St Maarten. For children between 5 and 10 years, a throat swab is accepted.
column3: Quarantine Requirement- Unknown where. If you’re fully vaccinated: If you’re fully vaccinated, you can enter St Maarten without needing to test or quarantine. Find out if you qualify as fully vaccinated in St Maarten on the website of the Government of St Maarten.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: All travellers should complete and submit the health declaration form (EHAS process) 72 hours prior to travel. Part of the application process is the purchase of a mandatory COVID-19 insurance. Further information on entry requirements can be found on the website of the Government of St Maarten. There are no border formalities when crossing St Maarten from the Dutch side to the French side.
If you’re fully vaccinated: If you’re fully vaccinated, you can enter St Maarten without needing to test or quarantine. At least 14 days must have passed since your last dose of the vaccine and the vaccine must be approved by the government of St Maarten.
Find out if you qualify as fully vaccinated in St Maarten on the website of the Government of St Maarten. Proof of vaccination status: You must present proof that you have been fully vaccinated to enter St Maarten. The proof of vaccination needs to be uploaded as part of the Electronic Health Authorization System (EHAS) process. This applies to all travellers aged five years and above.
If you’re not fully vaccinated: If you’re not fully vaccinated, you’ll need to show proof of a negative PCR test, taken no more than 48 hours before departure, when entering St Maarten. For children between 5 and 10 years, a throat swab is accepted.
If you’ve had COVID-19 in the past year: If you’re not fully vaccinated but have tested positive for COVID-19 recently, you can enter St Maarten. You’ll need to show evidence of a positive PCR test taken not more than 9 months before your departure. You will not need to take an additional COVID-19 test.
If your positive test was more than 9 months ago before departure, you need to take a pre-departure test.
Children and young people: Children aged 5 and above can follow the rules for adult travellers to enter St Maarten. For children between 5 and 10 years, a throat swab is accepted as pre-departure test.Children aged 4 and under do not need to show proof of vaccination or a negative PCR test to enter St Maarten. If you’re transiting through St Maarten: Transiting passengers are required to complete the EHAS application form but do not need to take out the mandatory insurance.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in St Maarten: The Government of St Maarten has put measures in place in response to the coronavirus pandemic. See the website of the Government of St Maarten for updates and details of these measures, including guidance on what you should do if you test positive for COVID-19 during your stay.
*Accommodation: Travellers must familiarise themselves with the guidelines and protocols of their accommodation and activity providers and adhere to them.
column6: OSAC Travel Advisories/ US State Dept. COVID-19 Country Specific Information/ Foreign travel advice, Gov.UK/
